rook.api.transport

Interface BroadcastTransport

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleBroadcastTransport

    public interface BroadcastTransport
    Transport for broadcast messages. Broadcast messages are sent once and delivered to all services that are currently connected to the environment.
    Author:
    Eric Thill

    • Method Summary

    • Method Detail

      • addMessageConsumer

        void addMessageConsumer(BroadcastMessageConsumer<GrowableBuffer> consumer)
        Add a broadcast message consumer. This will not join the given group. Use the join(RID group) method to start receiving group messages.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The message consumer

      • addMessageConsumer

        void addMessageConsumer(RID group,
                        RID from,
                        BroadcastMessageConsumer<GrowableBuffer> consumer)
        Add a broadcast message consumer for the given group from a specified service. This will not join the given group. Use the join(RID group) method to start receiving group messages.
        Parameters:
        group - Optional. Filters callbacks that are not for the given group.
        from - Optional. Filters callbacks that are not from the given service id.
        consumer - The message consumer

      • addMessageConsumer

        <T> void addMessageConsumer(RID group,
                            RID from,
                            BroadcastMessageConsumer<T> consumer,
                            Deserializer<T> deserializer)
        Add a deserializing broadcast message consumer for the given group from a specified service. This will not join the given group. Use the join(RID group) method to start receiving group messages.
        Parameters:
        group - Optional. Filters callbacks that are not for the given group.
        from - Optional. Filters callbacks that are not from the given service id.
        consumer - The message consumer
        deserializer - The deserializer that converts a binary message into an object to be consumed

      • removeMessageConsumer

        <T> void removeMessageConsumer(BroadcastMessageConsumer<T> consumer)
        Remove a broadcast message consumer.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer to remove

      • join

        void join(RID group)
        Join the given broadcast group. Callbacks will not receive messages until a group is joined.
        Parameters:
        group - The group to join

      • leave

        void leave(RID group)
        Leave the given broadcast group. This will stop the flow of messages to callbacks for the given group.
        Parameters:
        group - The group to leave

      • addJoinConsumer

        void addJoinConsumer(BroadcastJoinConsumer consumer)
        Add a consumer to listen to JOIN events
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer

      • removeJoinConsumer

        void removeJoinConsumer(BroadcastJoinConsumer consumer)
        Remove a JOIN event consumer
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer

      • addLeaveConsumer

        void addLeaveConsumer(BroadcastLeaveConsumer consumer)
        Add a consumer to listen to LEAVE events
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer

      • removeLeaveConsumer

        void removeLeaveConsumer(BroadcastLeaveConsumer consumer)
        Remove a LEAVE event consumer
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer

      • send

        void send(RID group,
          GrowableBuffer message)
        Send a broadcast message for the given group
        Parameters:
        group - The broadcast group. Any services that have joined this group will receive the message.
        message - The message

      • send

        <T> void send(RID group,
              T message,
              Serializer<T> serializer)
        Serialize and send a broadcast message for the given group. This method is intended to be used by services that are able to connect multiple routers into a single environment.
        Parameters:
        group - The broadcast group. Any services that have joined this group will receive the message.
        message - The unserialized message
        serializer - The serializer that will serialize the message

      • incognito_join

        void incognito_join(RID fromService,
                    RID group)
        Send a JOIN event on behalf of another service. This method is intended to be used by services that are able to connect multiple routers into a single environment.
        Parameters:
        fromService - The "sending" service
        group - The group

      • incognito_leave

        void incognito_leave(RID fromService,
                     RID group)
        Send a LEAVE event on behalf of another service. This method is intended to be used by services that are able to connect multiple routers into a single environment.
        Parameters:
        fromService - The "sending" service
        group - The group

      • incognito_send

        void incognito_send(RID fromService,
                    RID group,
                    GrowableBuffer message)
        Send a broadcast message on behalf of another service. This method is intended to be used by services that are able to connect multiple routers into a single environment.
        Parameters:
        fromService - The "sending" service
        group - The group
        message - The message

      • incognito_send

        <T> void incognito_send(RID fromService,
                        RID group,
                        T message,
                        Serializer<T> serializer)
        Serialize and send a broadcast message on behalf of another service. This method is intended to be used by services that are able to connect multiple routers into a single environment.
        Parameters:
        fromService - The "sending" service
        group - The group
        message - The unserialized message
        serializer - The serializer will serialize the message
